Back in the darkness . . . 

A large form was dangling over a large pit! Im=
mense chains extending from both the ceiling and the floor held the helples=
s figure with its arms and legs spread and pulled almost to the breaking po=
int. From the pit dark energies seemed to boil as purple flames frothed and=
 flickered from the dark depths below - a strange smoke rose up seeming to =
almost caress the figure that was being held above it. 

"Is he ready yet?"=
 It was MAGMATRON, his voice imperious and powerful as he spoke, for the mo=
ment only his optics could be seen glowing malevolently in the deep gloom. =


There was a pause and SABERBACK spoke, "Soon, very soon." He was floating=
 next to MAGMATRON, using some sort of antigravity technologies. "We knew t=
hat even once we collected what we needed it would still take time."

The f=
igure dangling over the pit looked over at MAGMATRON and SABERBACK, its own=
 optics glowing dimly in the darkness. "You will not succeed!" There was a =
pause, "You will be stopped."

MAGMATRON chuckled as he looked back at the =
figure, "Oh? And who will stop me, you?"

"The Autobots . . ." the figure p=
aused and started again, "The Maximals will . . ." 

"The Autobots are a dy=
ing husk and the Maximals are nothing!" MAGMATRON cut in. "The sooner you u=
nderstand that the better off you will be!"

The figure fell silent, his en=
ergy reserves seemingly spent with his words. 

SABERBACK produced a small =
device and directed it at the helpless figure, "Yes, it is time for the nex=
t dose."

There was a single nod from MAGMATRON, in the gloom the movement =
noticeable by the glow of his optics. "Proceed."

With a seemingly simple w=
ave of SABERBACK's hand the fire and energy from the pit began to roll and =
brighten, tendrils of energy sparked and cascaded, until what seemed like b=
lack and purple lightning bolts erupted from the pit!

The figure spasmed i=
n pain as he arched his back and his head fell back in a silent scream as e=
ven the ability to make noise was ripped away from it!

It was only now in =
the dim flickering light of the arcing energy that the figures of MAGMATRON=
 and SABERBACK could truly be discerned, and that of their prisoner. 

OPTI=
MUS PRIME

- Preston
